product_description.product_use: Ready-mix concrete for construction projects including residential, high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, and public works infrastructure

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for residential applications, low rise buildings, paving and driveways; specification and ordering simplified
product_classes.special_class: Allows purchaser to incorporate special requirements such as high-strength, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.hazard_classification: Classified as Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to gate)
databases_and_software_used: Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI) (2017)
World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD) Cement Sustainability Initiative (CSI) Tool Project Database (International Version) (2018)
Product specific EPDs for admixtures and fibres

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m² of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No flows excluded on basis of cut-off criteria
lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate; excludes personnel, infrastructure and production equipment not directly consumed in process; excludes life cycle stages beyond gate

data_quality.foreground_data: Medium or higher geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data: Updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2012:01

transport.details: Transport by transoceanic freight ship, rigid truck and/or domestic freight ship included in system boundary (modules A2, A3)

installation.notes: Life cycle stages beyond gate including installation are excluded from this EPD

scenarios_described: Disposal of concrete at landfill site
Reuse of recovered concrete elements in new construction works
Use of concrete debris in land restoration
Crushing/recycling of concrete: substitution of primary material or natural aggregates
end_of_life.notes: End of life scenarios can result in benefits and loads outside system boundary and should be considered in whole-of-life building studies; not included in this EPD

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_process: Concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere over its lifetime through carbonation, partially offsetting CO2 emitted during cement manufacturing
carbon_emission_context.carbonation_consideration: Not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results tables
carbon_emission_context.reference_standard: BS EN 16757:2017 for calculation of CO2 absorption

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.database_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted as default for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.conformance: AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804 when applying allocation

additional_info.about_holcim: Leading supplier of construction materials in Australia, operating across the continent with network of plants, quarries, precast and pipe places, mobile and on-site facilities; part of LafargeHolcim
additional_info.about_lafargeholcim: Global leader in building materials and solutions active in Cement, Aggregates, Ready-mix Concrete and Solutions & Products; operates in around 80 countries with 75,000 employees
additional_info.virodecs_special: Project-specific, on-demand EPDs for ready-mix concrete in Australia; first product in Australia with EPD Process Certification allowing in-house compliant EPD production; supports sustainability performance reporting
additional_info.disclaimer: Publication supersedes previous literature; specifications may change; users must determine suitability; Holcim accepts no liability for loss or damage from use or reliance on information; trademarks noted
